arm_group.description: Ectoin Allergy Nasal Spray (Medical Device, drug-like)

brief_summary.textblock:
This is a comparative, open label, parallel group, non interventional study to further
      demonstrate the effectiveness and tolerability of Ectoin® Allergy Nasal Spray. In addition
      the effectiveness and safety shall be compared to a Beclomethasone nasal spray. The patient
      applies Ectoin® Rhinitis Nasal Spray or Beclomethasone nasal spray according to the
      instructions for use. The observation takes place over a period of 14 days. Response to
      treatment is recorded at day 7 and day 14 by the physician and in daily by the patient in a
      dairy.

clinical_study.brief_title: Application of Ectoin Allergy Nasal Spray in Comparison to Beclomethasone Nasal Spray

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Diagnosed  allergic  rhinitis during the observational period

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Contra indications according to the label

clinical_study.official_title: Non Interventional Study of Ectoin Allergy Nasal Spray Compared to Beclomethasone Nasal Spray

oversight_info.authority: Germany: Federal Institute for Drugs and Medical Devices

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Total Nasal Symptom Score

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy and tolerability assessment by the patients and  by the investigator
Change in quality of life assessed by Rhinitis Quality of  Life Questionnaire

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Prospective
